thread.title: Report: Apple to launch 128GB iPhone SE, red iPhone 7 / 7 Plus and new iPad Pro lineup in March
thread.title_full: Report: Apple to launch 128GB iPhone SE, red iPhone 7 / 7 Plus and new iPad Pro lineup in March

title: Report: Apple to launch 128GB iPhone SE, red iPhone 7 / 7 Plus and new iPad Pro lineup in March
text:
February 21, 2017 “The compact Apple iPhone SE may soon be available in a new 128GB storage model” 
Apple recently revealed that it will be hosting its annual Worldwide Developer Conference (WWDC) between June 5th and June 9th this year. Apple traditionally skips device launches at WWDC, and focusses on showcasing new versions of iOS, macOS and watchOS at the event. Now it appears that the company will also be holding another event before WWDC in March. Japanese website Mac Otakara reports that the brand will be introducing new 128GB iPhone SE , red iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus and new iPad Pro line up at the event. 
As per the report, Apple will add a new 128GB storage option to the iPhone SE, apart from the already available 16GB and 64GB variants. The news of the iPhone SE comes at an interesting time, given that Apple is set to start assembling the compact iPhone in India soon. The brand will also add a new red colour option for the iPhone 7 and iPhone 7 Plus, which so far are available in Matte Black, Jet Black, Gold and Silver hues. The source earlier suggested the red hue for the upcoming iPhone 7s and iPhone 7s Plus models. 
As for the new iPad Pro line up, the report claims that Apple will introduce new 7.9-inch, 9.7-inch, 10.5-inch and 12.9-inch models. The 10.5-inch model will start shipping in May, while the other size models are tipped to go on sale in March itself. Lastly, the source claims that Apple will introduce new Watch bands at the event.
